acceptOwnershipTransfer().details: Allows the new owner (candidate) to accept the ownership transfer request. Can only be called by the proposed new owner.

addAdmin(address).details: Adds the specified address to the list of administrators.

params.account: The address to add to the administrator list.

returns._0: Returns true if the operation was successful.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

assignTrustee(address).details: Assigns or changes the trustee wallet.

params.account: Enter a wallet address which will become the new trustee.

returns._0: Returns true if the operation was successful.

candidate().details: Returns the address of the candidate owner.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

params.account: The account to redeem the digital securities from.
params.amount: The amount of units to redeem.

getTransferState().details: Transfer state dictates if the tokens can be freely transferred by the token holders. When transfers are in disabled state, only the administrators have the ability to perform token transfers.

returns._0: If the return value is `true`, it means tokens are freely transferrable.

getTrustee().details: The trustee wallet has the power to change  the owner in case of unforeseen or unavoidable situation.

returns._0: Wallet address of the trustee account.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

isAdmin(address).details: Checks if an address is an administrator.

returns._0: Returns true if the specified wallet  is in fact an administrator.

isOwner(address).details: Checks if the provided address is the contract owner.

returns._0: Returns true if the entered address is the owner.

params.account: The account to issue the digital securities to.
params.amount: The amount of tokens to issue.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

owner().details: Returns the address of the contract owner.

reassignOwner(address).details: Changes the owner of this contract. The new owner still needs to accept the ownership transfer request before the transfer becomes effective.

params.newOwner: Specify a wallet address which will become the new owner.

returns._0: Returns true if the operation was successful.

params.token: The amount of token to reclaim.

params.account: The account to redeem the digital securities from.
params.amount: The amount of units to redeem.

removeAdmin(address).details: Removes the specified address from the list of administrators.

params.account: The address to remove from the administrator list.

returns._0: Returns true if the operation was successful.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}; Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers the ownership of this contract to a new account (`newOwner`).

params.newOwner: The proposed new owner of this contract.

OwnershipTransferAccepted(address,addres.notice: Triggered when the new account accepts  the request to become the new owner  of this contract.

OwnershipTransferRequested(address,addre.notice: Triggered when existing owner requests to  transfer the ownership to a new account.

acceptOwnershipTransfer().notice: This feature is restricted for candidate use only.

addAdmin(address).notice: This feature is restricted for admin use only.

assignTrustee(address).notice: This feature is restricted for owner use only.

disableTransfers().notice: Enables owners and administrators to disable transfer state on global level. When transfer state is disabled, no one  but the administrators can transfer tokens.

enableTransfers().notice: Resume the transfer state on global level. Meaning, everyone can transfer their tokens freely.

forceRedeem(address,uint256).notice: Forcefully redeems the digital securities held by the specified account.

issue(address,bytes32,uint256).notice: Issues the specified value of the tokens to the destination address .

reassignOwner(address).notice: This feature is restricted for trustee use only.

reclaimEther().notice: Transfers all Ether held by the contract to the caller.

reclaimToken(address).notice: Transfers all ERC20 tokens held by the contract to the caller.

redeem(address,bytes32,uint256).notice: Redeems the digital securities held by the specified account.

removeAdmin(address).notice: This feature is restricted for admin use only.

transferOwnership(address).notice: Ownership change will not be effective unless the new owner accepts it by calling the function `acceptOwnershipTransfer`.   The existing contract owner can submit multiple ownership transfer requests before the transfer is actually accepted. If the owner submits multiple ownership transfer requests, only the last proposed `newOwner` will be able to accept to honor the request.   This feature is restricted for owner use only.

unpause().notice: Unpauses the contract and returns to normal state.
